document_title: Myopia: Causes, signs, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_content:
Myopia is a common refractive error that makes it difficult for patients to see distant objects but can see very close objects clearly.
Myopia is  common in school age and adolescents, especially from 8 – 12 years old. In adolescence, when the body develops rapidly, nearsightedness becomes more serious. However, from age 20 onwards, nearsightedness rarely changes. [2]
A basic eye exam can detect nearsightedness. Patients can reduce blurriness with eyeglasses, contact lenses or refractive surgery.
